item.title: GeeCon - Testing hell and how to fix it
item.description: GeeCon - Testing hell and how to fix it # The last regular talk I went to was on testing hell at Atlassian â€“ in particular the JIRA project. What happened to JIRA might actually be known to developers who have to deal with huge legacy projects that predate the junit and dependency injection era: Over time their test base grew into a monster that was hard to maintain and didn’t help at all with making developers confident on checkin time that they would not break anything.
